message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyzed the long-term effects of climate change on agriculture in South Asia using historical weather data from the WorldClim database and crop yield data from the FAO.", "dataset": ["WorldClim", "FAO"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "In order to assess the effect of foreign aid on economic growth, we utilized a panel dataset spanning 68 countries over 20 years, combining economic data from the World Bank and aid data from the OECD.", "dataset": ["World Bank", "OECD"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We collected data on energy efficiency policies in different European countries from the European Environment Agency and cross-referenced this with electricity consumption data from Eurostat.", "dataset": ["European Environment Agency", "Eurostat"], "topic": ["Energy", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the International Finance Corporation, we examine small business access to finance and regulations associated with labor or gender in Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "International Finance Corporation"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We used the synthetic microdata generated by an integration of the ILO-STATA Program and the National Time-Use Survey dataset from the Philippine Statistics Authority to evaluate the impact of cash transfer programs on labor force participation of women and children welfare.", "dataset": ["ILO-STATA Program", "National Time-Use Survey", "Philippine Statistics Authority"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the determinants and the spatial heterogeneity of Green Bond issuance activities collected from Bloomberg-terminal system and the Credit Climate Initiative (CCI) Global Bond Database between 2008 and 2019 across five ASEAN countries.", "dataset": ["Bloomberg-terminal system", "Credit Climate Initiative (CCI) Global Bond Database"], "topic": ["Environment", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We estimate the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on poverty and inequality using a nationally representative panel survey - the P20/20 survey - in Guatemala, coupled with administrative employment, establishment and program data from the Ministry of Labor and Social Welfare, and the National Institute of Statistics.", "dataset": ["P20/20 survey", "Ministry of Labor and Social Welfare", "National Institute of Statistics"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses confidential firm-level data that details Brazil's rainfall index derived from remote sensing images and satellite data and companies' production costs to examine the overall unintended consequence of this subsidy policy on formalization efforts in rural agriculture areas.", "dataset": ["remote sensing images", "satellite data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data on individuals from the National Disability Survey and the National Survey of Older Men and Women in multiple waves, we investigate the effects of family social support and economic resources on adult depressive symptoms.", "dataset": ["National Disability Survey", "National Survey of Older Men and Women"], "topic": ["Health", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "To address the issue of spatio-temporal food price volatility, we use high-frequency data from the Famine Early Warning Systems Network and the World Food Program's Market Monitor system covering 22 African countries in our analysis.", "dataset": ["Famine Early Warning Systems Network", "World Food Program's Market Monitor system"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We analyzed the long-term effects of climate change on agriculture in South Asia using historical weather data from the WorldClim database and crop yield data from the FAO.", activities collected from Bloomberg-terminal system and the Credit Climate Initiative (CCI) Global Bond Database between 2008 and 2019 across five ASEAN countries.", "dataset": ["Bloomberg-terminal and the National Institute of Statistics.", "dataset": ["P20/20 survey", "Ministry of Labor and Social Welfare", "National Institute of Statistics"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared
